COMMENT: It does not regard itself a political party and claims to be non-affiliated to the traditional left/right-scale, hence it does not contest national parliamentary or local elections. Its traditional base is found among left-wingers and trade union members, but there are also non-partisans and non-socialist members, e.g., from the Social Liberal Party, the Social Democrats, the Conservative Party, the Green Party and the small Georgist liberal Justice Party.
The same party as above, its abbreviation is “A”.

This is basically the upper KRF party since it was founded id 1970 as as the Christian People's Party (Kristeligt Folkeparti)
The same as above, this is a Party with abbreviation “A”, called Socialdemokratiet
This is is a political party in Greenland in the social democratic tradition. Party members have been elected to both the parliament of Greenland and the parliament of Denmark.
a conservative-liberal, agrarian political party on the Faroe Islands
a left-wing political party on the Faroe Islands committed to Faroese independence
